definition: absolutely still/fig. not the slightest change/also written 紋風不動|纹风不动
early Tang literary style despised as shallow by the classicists

sentences.english: Paying more attention in the style of writing is the good traditions of our Party all the time.
sentences.chinese: 高度重視文風建設是我們黨一以貫之的優良傳統。

sentences.english: A lapidary style of literary writing stresses precision, depth and lean refinement.
sentences.chinese: 優雅嚴謹的文風強調的是精確，深刻和優雅。

sentences.english: The sixth chapter "the Yuan Can Article States Discusses": Analyzes Yuan Can's write Style and doctrine attainments in Buddhist.
sentences.chinese: 分析袁粲嬉笑怒罵的文風及其在佛法中的造詣。

sentences.english: The present-day American English is suffering from certain unhealthy styles.
sentences.chinese: 現代美國英語出現了若干不正文風。

sentences.english: The writing style of the Imperial Ministries was prevalent throughout the first part of the Ming dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 雍容平正的臺閣文風盛行於明代前期。

sentences.english: Find out if thereare logical arguments in your paper and the proper style is used.
sentences.chinese: 檢查文中有沒有邏輯問題，文風是否得當。

sentences.english: The "clear forming" of Xies' writing style is related to influence of$…
sentences.chinese: 謝氏子弟文風之“清”的形成也與佛教的影響有關。

sentences.english: The book was polished time and again so that its style is similar to that of the Eastern Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 其書在形成過程中被一再脩潤，故其文風類似東漢人。

sentences.english: Natural style, however, should not be conquered at the expense of fidelity.
sentences.chinese: 自然流暢的文風，不應該以犧牲忠實爲代價。

sentences.english: The writing style without polished have set us a good example to the aftertime translation of Scriptures.
sentences.chinese: 那不加潤飾的文風給後世譯經事業留下一個好榜樣。

sentences.english: Qing Emperor Qianlong, the style Kusakabe, over a hundred years, not even the first of those.
sentences.chinese: 清乾隆後，文風日下，百餘年間竟無中第者。

sentences.english: The style of Dryden is capricious and varied, that of Pope is cautious and uniform;
sentences.chinese: 德萊頓的文風隨性多變，蒲柏則謹慎工整。

definition: style of study/academic atmosphere/school discipline/school traditions
a genre of poetry, developed in the Tang Dynasty, characterized by its strict form
old verse/poetry in the old style
a hundred schools of thought contend (idiom); refers to the classical philosophic schools of the Warring States period 475-221 BC
lit. enough books to make a pack-ox sweat or to fill a house to the rafters (idiom); fig. many books
